snippet: Police Officer Adrian Schoolcraft, a whistle-blower who is suing the city, had numerous recordings of what he suspected was misconduct — and of his forced psychiatric hospitalization.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on the latest developments in the case of NYC Police Officer Adrian Schoolcraft, who is suing the city after claiming that his revelations about the manipulation of crime statistics in the 81st Precinct in Brooklyn were behind his involuntary detention in a psychiatric facility; says Schoolcraft may have the upper hand because he secretly recorded his interactions with the police supervisors who were present when he was removed from his home.
lead_paragraph: Police Officer Adrian Schoolcraft, a whistle-blower who is suing the city, had numerous recordings of what he suspected was misconduct — and of his forced psychiatric hospitalization.
